overview.title: Current Month Overview
overview.description: These metrics show your financial performance for {{month}}, giving you a snapshot of your cash flow health.
overview.importance: These are the most important numbers to monitor for immediate cash flow management.

inflow.title: Total Inflow
inflow.description: All money coming into your business this month from sales, services, and other revenue sources. This is your "top line" number.

outflow.title: Total Outflow
outflow.description: All money going out of your business this month including operational costs, salaries, rent, and other business outflow.

finalBalance.title: Final Balance
finalBalance.description: Your cash position at the end of the month. Formula: Starting Balance + Inflow - Outflow

lowestBalance.title: Lowest Balance
lowestBalance.description: The lowest your cash balance got during the month. Important for understanding cash flow timing and avoiding overdrafts.

cashGeneration.title: Cash Generation
cashGeneration.description: Net cash flow for the month (Inflow - Outflow). Positive means you generated cash, negative means you consumed cash.

quickActions.title: Quick Actions
quickActions.subtitle: Use these metrics to:
quickActions.action2: Identify if you're cash positive or negative
quickActions.action3: Spot potential cash flow problems early
quickActions.action4: Make decisions about expenses and investments

overview.title: Year to Date Cash Flow
overview.description: Year to Date shows your cumulative cash flow performance from January 1st through the current month.
overview.purpose: These numbers help you understand your overall financial trajectory for the year.

uses.compare: Compare against annual goals and budgets

totalInflow.title: Total Inflow (YTD)
totalInflow.description: Sum of all income from January through the current month. This shows your revenue generation capacity for the year.

totalOutflow.title: Total Outflow (YTD)
totalOutflow.description: Sum of all expenses from January through the current month. Helps track spending patterns and cost control.

netBalance.title: Net Balance (YTD)
netBalance.description: Your cumulative cash generation for the year (Total Inflow - Total Outflows). Shows if you're profitable year-to-date.

upward.title: Upward Trend
upward.description: Cash flow improving over time - indicates business growth and better financial health.

seasonal.title: Seasonal Patterns
seasonal.description: Regular ups and downs that repeat yearly - helps predict cash needs during slow periods.

volatility.title: Volatility
volatility.description: Large month-to-month swings may indicate inconsistent revenue or lumpy expenses.

declining.title: Declining Trend
declining.description: Consistently worsening cash flow - may require immediate strategic intervention.

whatAre.description: Trend forecasts use statistical analysis of your historical data to project future performance, helping you plan and make informed decisions.

trendAnalysis.description: Analyzes historical data points to identify the overall direction and rate of change

linearRegression.description: Calculates the best-fit line through your data to project future values

confidenceIntervals.title: 3. Confidence Intervals
confidenceIntervals.description: Shows the range where future values are likely to fall (95% probability)

considerations.title: Important Considerations
considerations.nearTermAccuracyDesc: Forecasts are most reliable for 1-2 months ahead
considerations.linearAssumptionDesc: Assumes trends continue at the same rate
considerations.externalFactorsDesc: Cannot predict market changes or disruptions

profitMargins.title: Understanding Profit Margins Trend
profitMargins.chartDescription: This chart tracks your gross and net profit margins over time, showing how efficiently your business converts revenue into profit across different months.
profitMargins.marginsImportance: Margins are more important than absolute dollar amounts because they show profitability efficiency.
profitMargins.grossMarginDesc: Shows what percentage of revenue remains after direct costs
profitMargins.netMarginDesc: Shows what percentage of revenue becomes final profit
profitMargins.useMarginTrends: Use margin trends to optimize profitability and make data-driven business decisions.

revenueProfitability.title: Understanding Revenue & Profitability Chart
revenueProfitability.chartDescription: This bar chart compares revenue, gross profit, and net income across months, showing the "profit waterfall" from top-line revenue to bottom-line profit.
revenueProfitability.absoluteAmounts: Each bar shows absolute dollar amounts, helping you see both growth trends and profit efficiency.
revenueProfitability.revenueDesc: Total income from sales - your "top line" number
revenueProfitability.grossProfitDesc: Revenue minus direct costs - what's left after production
revenueProfitability.netIncomeDesc: Final profit after all expenses - your "bottom line"
revenueProfitability.useChartTo: Use this chart to track business growth and profitability trends over time.

comparisonPeriods.title: Understanding Comparison Periods
comparisonPeriods.description: Comparison periods help you understand how your business performance changes over time. Each metric shows a percentage change compared to the selected period.
comparisonPeriods.previousMonthDesc: Compares current month metrics to the immediately preceding month. Useful for tracking short-term trends and seasonal variations.
comparisonPeriods.previousQuarterDesc: Compares current month to the same month in the previous quarter. Helps identify quarterly patterns and growth.
comparisonPeriods.samePeriodLastYearDesc: Compares current month to the same month last year. Best for understanding year-over-year growth and eliminating seasonal effects.

personnel.title: Understanding Personnel Cost Analysis
personnel.description: Personnel costs are typically the largest expense for most companies. This analysis helps you understand:
personnel.point4: Personnel costs as a percentage of revenue
personnel.includesText: This includes salaries, payroll taxes, health coverage, and benefits
personnel.totalCostDesc: Sum of all employee-related expenses including salaries, taxes, and benefits. Industry benchmark: 20-50% of revenue depending on business type.
personnel.efficiencyDesc: Revenue generated per ARS spent on personnel. Higher is better. Formula: Revenue ÷ Personnel Cost
personnel.vsOpexDesc: Shows what portion of operating expenses goes to personnel. Typically 50-70% for service companies, lower for product companies.
personnel.understandingAllocation: Understanding where your personnel costs are allocated:
personnel.trackRevenuePerEmployee: Track revenue per employee over time
personnel.compareIndustryBenchmarks: Compare personnel costs to industry benchmarks
personnel.investInTraining: Invest in training to increase productivity
personnel.reviewBenefitCosts: Review benefit costs regularly for savings

costEfficiency.title: Understanding Cost Efficiency Metrics
costEfficiency.description: Cost efficiency metrics help you understand how effectively your company converts revenue into profit by analyzing cost structure and ratios.
costEfficiency.lowerBetter: Lower percentages generally indicate better efficiency and higher profitability.

cor.title: Cost of Revenue % (CoR%)
cor.description: Direct costs to produce your product/service as % of revenue. Lower is better. Industry benchmarks:

opex.title: Operating Expense % (OpEx%)
opex.description: Overhead costs (sales, admin, R&D) as % of revenue. Includes all expenses not directly tied to production. Target: 20-40% for healthy companies.

revenueGrowth.title: Understanding Revenue Growth Analysis
revenueGrowth.monthOverMonthGrowthDesc: Compares current month revenue to previous month. Shows immediate momentum. Target: 5-20% monthly growth for healthy businesses.
revenueGrowth.averageMonthlyRevenueDesc: Your baseline revenue performance across all analyzed months. Used for budgeting and forecasting future periods.
revenueGrowth.revenueTrendDesc: Overall direction comparing first and last month in the period. Growing trends indicate business expansion and market success.
revenueGrowth.seasonalPatternsDesc: Regular ups and downs throughout the year
revenueGrowth.volatilityDesc: Large swings may indicate external factors
